Title: Proof of Normal Subgroups and Factor Groups Based on Java Programming Language
Affiliations: Mathematics Departement, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jln. Kebon Jeruk Raya No.27, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Manik, N.I., Mathematics Departement, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jln. Kebon Jeruk Raya No.27, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This research succeeded in developing an application program based on Java programming language. The software is able to prove abstract algebra, especially Normal Subgroups and Factor Groups. The result from the software program developed indicated that the proof of Normal Subgroups and Factor Groups could be done properly and correctly and relatively faster than if done manually. © 2017 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: abstract algebra; factor groups; normal subgroup
Index Keywords: Algebra; Application programs; Artificial intelligence; Computer programming; Computer programming languages; Computer software; Abstract algebra; factor groups; normal subgroup; Software program; Java programming language
References: Bergstra, J.A., Tucker, J.V., Division safe calculation in totalised fields (2015) Theory Computer System, 43 (1), pp. 410-424; Caenepeel, S., Verschoren, A., Noncommutative rings and geometry (2014) Algebras and Representation Theory, 12 (2-5), pp. 101-102; Wallace, D.A.R., The algebraic stucture of group rings (2014) Bulletin of American Mathematical Society, 1 (2), pp. 210-220; Okur, M., Dikici, R., Sanalan, V.A., Tatar, E., Computer applications in teaching abstract algebra (2011) International Journal of Applied Science and Technology, 1 (1), pp. 20-27; Manik, N.I., Tasman, D., Turang, P.C., Testing of mathematical group structure based on an Open Source Program (OSP) (2013) Applied Mathematical Sciences, 7 (80), pp. 3975-3987; Iswati, Suryoto, K-Aljabar (2010) Jurnal Matematika, 13 (1), pp. 20-33; Nancy, (2009) Program Aplikasi Pengujian Group, , Thesis Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta; Saputra, A., (2010) Perancangan Program Aplikasi Pengujian Struktur Aljabar Grup Khusus (Abelian, Siklik, Homomorfisma, Isomorfisma, Monomorfisma, Dan Epimorfisma), , Thesis Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta; Carlson, D., The Teaching and Learning of Tertiary Algebra (2013) Prosiding Seminar Nasional Aljabar Dan Pengajaran Aljabar di Perguruan Tinggi, Yogyakarta, pp. 13-25; Pevtsova, J., Witherspoon, S., Varieties for modules of quantum elementary Abelian Groups (2015) Algebras and Representation Theory, 12 (6), pp. 567-595; Lethbridge, T.C., Laganiere, R., (2012) Object Oriented Software Engineering: Practical Software Development Using UML and Java, , McGraw-Hill New York; Turban, E., Rainer, R.K., Potter, R.E., (2014) Introduction to Information Technology, , John Wiley and Sons London

Authors: Aditya R., Zulfikar M.T., Manik N.I.
Title: Testing Division Rings and Fields Using a Computer Program
Affiliations: Department of Mathematics and Statistics, Bina Nusantara University, KH Syahdan Street 9, Palmerah, West-Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Aditya, R., Department of Mathematics and Statistics, Bina Nusantara University, KH Syahdan Street 9, Palmerah, West-Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Zulfikar, M.T., Department of Mathematics and Statistics, Bina Nusantara University, KH Syahdan Street 9, Palmerah, West-Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Manik, N.I., Department of Mathematics and Statistics, Bina Nusantara University, KH Syahdan Street 9, Palmerah, West-Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Algebra is a branch of mathematics which is studying algebraic structures of sets with respect to some operations on them. Each structure has its own axioms and properties. In some cases, to test what kind of structure is a given set and operations is difficult to be done manually. To help this, an application program to test algebraic structures is developed. In this article, we focus on two structures: division ring and fields, and an application program to test them is created by using Java, an open-source based programming language. This application program provides testing of various input of finite set such as integers, matrices and alphabets. By this application, testing of algebraic structures can be done faster than the manual one and its results are accurate. In this article, we focus on testing division rings and fields, together with some examples. © 2015 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Abstract Algebra; Computational Algebra; Division Rings; Fields
Index Keywords: Abstracting; Algebra; Application programs; Artificial intelligence; Computer software; Integer programming; Java programming language; Open source software; Abstract algebra; Algebraic structures; Computational algebra; Fields; Finite set; Open sources; Software testing
References: Gilbert, L., Gilbert, J., (2009) Elements of Modern Algebra, , 7th ed, Belmont: Brooks/Cole; Fraleigh, J.B., (2003) A First Course in Abstract Algebra, , 7 th ed. Boston: Addison-Wesley; Manik, N.I., Fortunatadewi, F., Tasman, D., Testing of Rings and Fields Using a Computer Program Journal of Software, 9 (5), pp. 1140-1150; Pressman, R.S., (2010) Software Engineering: A Practitioners Approach, , New York: McGraw
Conference name: 1st International Conference on Computer Science and Computational Intelligence, ICCSCI 2015

Authors: Sukandar A.R., Manik N.I., Purnomo F.
Title: Development of stock portfolio optimization application program using fuzzy linear programming
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jalan KH. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara University, Jalan Kebon Jeruk Raya No.27, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukandar, A.R., Bina Nusantara University, Jalan KH. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, Indonesia; Manik, N.I., Bina Nusantara University, Jalan Kebon Jeruk Raya No.27, Jakarta, Indonesia; Purnomo, F., Bina Nusantara University, Jalan KH. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Investing in the stock area is one of the popular category of investment nowadays. To get the maximum profit in stock trading, user usually creates a portfolio. In this paper the author present the Fuzzy Linear Programming approach to optimize the stock proportion in the Markowitz's portfolio selection model. Computer based program with PHP programming language are made to facilitate and improve the accuracy in the calculation of the optimal allocation of the stock portfolio selection. The computer program are able to passively analyze 45 best stocks contained in the Indonesia Stock Exchange. © 2014 Aga Rasyidi Sukandar, Ngarap Im Manik and Fredy Purnomo.
Author Keywords: Fuzzy linear programming; Optimization; Portfolio theory; Program development; Stock
References: Billbao, T.A., Perz, G.B., Arenas, P.M., Rodriguez, U.M.V., Fuzzy compromise Programming for Portfolio Selection (2006) Applied Mathematics & Computation, 173, pp. 251-264; Martin, F., UML Distilled: A Brief Guide to Standard Object Modelling Language (2003), Boston: Pearson Education; Chen, G., Chen, S., Fang, Y., Wang, S., A Possibilistic Mean VaR Model for Portfolio Selection (2006) AMO - Advanced Modeling and Optimization, 8 (1); Liu, H.-W., (2011) Linear Programming for Portfolio Selection Based on Fuzzy Decision-Making Theory, pp. 195-202. , The Tenth International Symposium on Operations Research and Its Applications Dunhuang China, August; Xu, J., A novel portfolio selection model in a hybrid uncertainty environment (2007) The International Journal of Management Science Omega; Inuiguchi, M., Ramik, J., Possibilistic linear programming: a brief review of fuzzy mathematical programming and a comparison with stochastic programming in portfolio selection problem (2000) Fuzzy Sets and Systems, 111, pp. 3-28; Pressman, R.S., Rekayasa Perangkat Lunak Pendekatan Praktisi: Edisi 7 (2012), Yogyakarta: Penerbit Andi; Nash, S.G., Sofer, A., Linear and Nonlinear Programming., , McGraw-Hill: New York. 1996; Vercher, E., Bermudez, J.D., Sgura, J.V., Fuzzy portfolio optimization under downside risk measures (2007) Fuzzy sets and Systems, 158, pp. 769-782; Wawan, T.N., Silvia, R., Penggunaan Algoritma Genetika untuk Pemilihan Portfolio Saham dalam Model Markowitz (2005) Jurnal Informatika, 6 (2), pp. 105-109. , Nopember; Luke, W., Thomson, L., (2001) PHP & MySQL Web Development, , Indianapolis: SAMS; Yoshimoto, A., The mean-variance approach to portfolio optimization subject to transaction costs (1996) Journal of the operational research society of Japan, 39, pp. 99-117

Authors: Manik N.I., Tasman D., Turang P.C.
Title: Testing of mathematical group structure based on an open source program (osp)
Affiliations: Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Palmerah, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Manik, N.I., Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Palmerah, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia; Tasman, D., Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Palmerah, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia; Turang, P.C., Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Palmerah, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Mathematical group structure is part of abstract algebra. It is useful in the development of solving method of problems that are abstract and difficult to test and represent through common algebraic operations. Thus, an open source-based computer program was developed to evaluate and prove a mathematical group structure. Several groups that are able to be tested and proved are aperiodic group, periodic group, mixed group, factor group, and normal subgroups. The developed program results showed that the evaluation of several types of the groups mentioned above performed well and perfect with a relatively shorter time than the manual test. In this program, the Java programming language was used since it can run well on several different operating system platforms. Besides, it is also able to be published free, so that programmers or other researchers can develop the application program further by adding more useful features. © 2013 Ngarap Im. Manik et al.
Author Keywords: Aperiodic group; Factor group; Normal subgroups; Periodic group
References: Saputra, A., Program aplikasi Pengujian Group (2009), Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta; Wallace, D.A., The algebraic structure of grouprings (2004) Bulletin of American Mathematical Society, 1 (2); Turban, E., Potter, R.E., Introduction to Information Technology (2012), London: John Wiley and Sons; Iswati, Suryoto, (2010) Jurnal Matematika, , K-Aljabar; Bergstra, J.A., Tucker, J.V., Division Safe Calculation in Totalized Fields (2008) Theory of Computer System, 43 (1), pp. 410-424; Pevtsova, J., Witherspoon, S., Varieties for modules of quantum elementary abelian groups (2009) Algebras and Representation Theory, 12 (2-5), pp. 74-86; Okur, M., Computer applications in teaching abstract algebra (2011) International Journal of Applied Science and Technology, 1 (1), pp. 20-27; Nancy, Program aplikasi Pengujian Group (2009), Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta; Manik, N.I., (2010), Pengujian Struktur Aljabar Grup, Ring, & Field Berbasis Komputer., in Prosiding SNM-2010 , Depok, Indonesia; Caenepeel, S., Verschoren, A., Noncommutative Rings and Geometry (2009) Algebras and Representation Theory, 12 (2-5), pp. 101-102; Lethbridge, T.C., Laganiere, R., Object Oriented Software Engineering: Practical Software Development Using UML and Java (2002), New York: McGraw Hill

Authors: Gazali W., Soeparno H., Manik N.I.
Title: The classification model of sandals Dhiif's product with back propagation and fourier descriptors method
Affiliations: Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Gazali, W., Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia; Manik, N.I., Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Classification is a vital process in every industry. While manual classification is inefficient in terms of cost and time, the computerized techniques offer better and faster solution on this matter. Fourier Descriptors is the mathematical formulas to save objects in functions of Fourier series. While back propagation is an Artificial Neural Network (ANN) method to recognize patterns and images through 'training'. Both of these methods will be used to produce a more efficient computerized techniques to the classification process itself. © 2013 Science Publications.
Author Keywords: Back Propagation; Classification; Fourier Descriptors; Pattern Recognition; Training
References: Arbter, K., (1989) Affine-invariant fourier descriptors, in from pixel to features, , Pixels Features; Deutsch, J.A., A theory of shape recognition (2011) Br. J. Title: Optimization of food menus for stroke patients using criss-cross method
Affiliations: Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Manik, N.I., Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia; Jessica, A.Y., Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: An optimization of diet preparation of patients' with stroke was done in the Satya Negara Hospital. It concerned to the nutritional needs of calories, proteins, fats, and carbohydrates as well as the purchase cost for the hospital management. Using the Criss-Cross method, the output of the model was obtained to help determine the number of each food to be compiled into an optimal diet for stroke patients.©2013 Ngarap Im.
References: Callahan, E., Microsoft Access 2000 Visual Basic for Applications Fundamentals (2001), Jakarta: Elex Media Komputindo; Hillier, F.S., Lieberman, G.J., (2005) Introduction to Operation Research, , 8 ed.
